com.google.gwt.gears.workerpool.client
Class WorkerPool

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.gears.workerpool.client.WorkerPool

public class WorkerPool
extends java.lang.Object

Used to create and manage JavaScript threads using the Gears WorkerPool system. A WorkerPool represents a group of JavaScript threads. Each thread runs in a separate JavaScript VM, and has an isolated namespace. That is, threads do not have access to any other threads' variables, including their parents'. WorkerPools can be used to group threads for convenience. Currently this class can only create worker threads out of raw JavaScript code. That is, user code cannot currently create worker bodies from Java code.

Method Detail

createWorkerFromString

public int createWorkerFromString(java.lang.String javaScript)
                           throws GearsException
Creates a JavaScript thread using the JavaScript code stored in javaScript. The code in javaScript is guaranteed to complete before this method returns. The code must set an onmessage handler (though it may be a no-op handler.)

Parameters:
javaScript - the JavaScript code to run in the thread
Returns:
the ID of the newly-created thread
Throws:
GearsException - if the worker could not be created
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the java script string is null

sendMessage

public void sendMessage(java.lang.String message,
                        int destWorker)
                 throws GearsException
Sends a message with the indicated data to the indicated thread. Messages can only be sent between members of the same WorkerPool.

Parameters:
message - the data to send
destWorker - the thread to send the data to
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - of message is null
GearsException - if the message cannot be sent to the specified destWorker

getJavaScriptObject

protected final com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getJavaScriptObject()
Returns the JavaScript WorkerPool object wrapped by this instance.

Returns:
the JavaScript WorkerPool object wrapped by this instance
